N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 125.11 - Permit traffic signals

State Regulations

In order to provide safe and expedient movement of traffic
to and from a commercial driveway, it may be necessary to install or modify a
traffic signal on the State highway. Such traffic signal shall be installed by
the property owner under a permit issued by the department if it is located at
a private road or driveway. Operation and maintenance of the signal will be
done by the department for an annual fee to be charged to the permittee. Operation and maintenance of signals erected prior to April 1, 1986 may be done
by the permittee under the terms of the existing maintenance agreement or by
the department for an annual fee, at the department's discretion. If a traffic
signal is to be modified, it may be necessary to obtain a highway work permit
as well as a permit for the signal modification. Notes
